newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Woolworths shares slip on poor outlook.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Woolworths shares slip on poor outlook.

text.p: The shares of grocery retailer Woolworths Ltd have fallen sharply on Thursday, the stock sold down on the poor outlook for the Australian retail sector, dealers said.
Woolworth shares closed 14 cents or 4.65 percent lower at A$2.87 on turnover of 4.4 million shares.
"A recent broker report has recommended a nil weighting for retail stocks and this appears to have affected Woolworths stock today," a Brisbane-based dealer said.
On Wednesday, Woolworths reported a 5.56 percent rise in its pre-tax operating profit to A$360.6 million on sales of A$13.99 billion.
The company's managing director Reg Clairs said Woolworths saw a continued tough retail environment in Australia over the 1996/97 year.
